snippet: The 40,389-mile Olympic torch relay to the Sochi Games in Russia, which hit a low point this week with the death of a runner, has proven to be an exercise in misfortune.
abstract: Torch relay leading to 2014 Olympic Games in Sochi, Russia, has had its share of ineptitude and misfortune, with reports of extinguished torches, fires and a runner's death; reports suggest that flame has died out as many as four dozen times along 40,000-mile trek, longest route in Olympic history, but Russia claims that it has only stopped burning three times.

byline.contributor: Patrick Reevell contributed reporting from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: The 40,389-mile Olympic torch relay to the Sochi Games in Russia, which hit a low point this week with the death of a runner, has proven to be an exercise in misfortune.

headline.main: Got a Light? Olympic Torch Relay Seems Cursed to the Ends of the Earth
headline.print_headline: Got a Light? Torch Relay Seems Cursed to the Ends of the Earth
